text: Heinz Auerswald (July 26, 1908 – December 5, 1970) was a lawyer and member of the SS in Nazi Germany. == Nazi career == Auerswald joined the SS in 1933. He became "Kommissar für den jüdischen Wohnbezirk" ("Commissioner for the Jewish Residential District") in Warsaw, Poland from April 1941 to November 1942. == After World War II == The West German government investigated him in the 1960s, but he was never charged with a crime. He died in 1970 at the age of 62. == Related pages == * Nazi Germany * Nazi Party * Schutzstaffel (SS) Category:1908 births Category:1970 deaths Category:Nazi leaders Category:SS officers
title: Heinz Auerswald
